HYPERLIQUID INTRODUCES PORTFOLIO MARGIN 

Hyperliquid is testing portfolio margin on testnet, merging spot and perpetual trading into a single margin account.
Instead of isolating positions, the system evaluates net portfolio risk, unlocking capital when positions hedge each other.

Why it matters:
* lower locked collateral
* higher capital efficiency
* spot & perps PnL netting
* idle assets generating yield

With more than $700M in TVL, Hyperliquid is positioning itself as a serious on-chain derivatives hub.

Is capital efficiency the key for DeFi to rival centralized exchanges?

üëâ Full analysis on https://t.co/7S9rewN9CJ

https://t.co/OWe9sFsAvm

üö® BITWISE UPGRADED ITS HYPERLIQUID ETF FILING WITH REAL DETAILS NOW ON THE TABLE.

Ticker: $BHYP
Fee: 0.67% (67 bps)
Listing venue: NYSE Arca

The ETF is designed as spot exposure to Hyperliquid, not derivatives.

NAV is calculated using a CF Benchmarks pricing reference.
Assets are held with institutional-grade custody at Anchorage.
Creations and redemptions happen in 10,000-share baskets.
Staking is included as a secondary objective, not a yield gimmick.

This is what a serious ETF filing looks like when it‚Äôs moving toward the finish line.

Technical Snapshot: $HYPE  30m Rebound Tests Key Resistance Levels üöÄ   Access the full institutional report at Finora AI: http://tinyurl.com/FinoraBot     The 30-minute chart for $HYPE  shows a bearish trend with a short-term bounce from the lower swing range boundary. Price attempts to challenge resistance near 27.095 may dictate the next directional move.    Current momentum seeks to overcome resistance around 27.095, which if decisively cleared, could open the path toward 28.255. Conversely, failure to hold above support near 26.460 would increase downside risk toward 26.048. The prevailing bias remains bearish unless strong bullish confirmation above 28.255 emerges. üìä   This briefing is summarized. The full institutional analysis is filed inside Finora AI.

As activity picks up around $HYPE   , $TON   is gaining more visibility as a native payment option inside Telegram, alongside Stars.   Payments are designed to be safe, with an escrow system that automatically returns funds if a deal doesn‚Äôt go through.  This makes it easy for users to buy and sell digital items directly within Telegram, creating a simple in-app marketplace. Breaking news from yesterday

- Pancake introduced Probable, a prediction marketplace incubated by them, launching soon on BNB.

- Ripple taps Wormhole adopting their NTT standard to expand issuance of RLUSD across ETH L2s (Optimism, Unichain, Ink Chain, Base)

- Circle acquired Interop Labs, the team behind Axelar, with Common Prefix set to lead Axelar going forward

- Phantom rolled out Phantom Cash debit cards

- Strategy acquired 10,645 BTC for $980.3M at 92,098 per BTC

- Hong Kong-based fintech focused on stablecoin payments raised $107M in Series B, round participants include Pantera, Goodwater Cap etc 

- SBI Holdings and Startale partner to launch Yen denominated stablecoin in Q2 2026 

- JPMorgan launched its first tokenized money-market fund, MONY, on Ethereum and seeded it with $100M

- MetaMask rolled out support for Bitcoin 

- Anchorage acquired Securitize 

- Bitwise amended its Hyperliquid filing adding ticker and fees, signaling an imminent launch.

- Bittensor TAO completed its halving
